attributes.action: Remove the IR35 tax trap on single-person limited companies, now that it has been shown to bring in only £1.5M a year.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: When IR35 was introduced it was expected to earn £220 million pounds a year from 'tax-dodging' self employed contractors. Instead it nearly destroyed an entire industry and introduced multiple extra complications. Figures released under a freedom of information request show it has brought in a palty £1.5m a year - far less than the cost of the encumbrance it imposes on HRMC and contractors, and clearly as a tax it is a failure.
